body_html:
Can you try I:\\Anaconda3 or I:/Anaconda3, I think it is because we have to escape \ when running in MSYS.
Once ./configure succeeds, the bazel failure should go away.

Exporting those environment variables is a good idea.

And thanks for reminding %VS140COMNTOOLS% environment variable, that could be very helpful.
body_text:
Can you try I:\\Anaconda3 or I:/Anaconda3, I think it is because we have to escape \ when running in MSYS.
Once ./configure succeeds, the bazel failure should go away.
Exporting those environment variables is a good idea.
And thanks for reminding %VS140COMNTOOLS% environment variable, that could be very helpful.
body:
Can you try `I:\\Anaconda3` or `I:/Anaconda3`, I think it is because we have to escape `\` when running in MSYS.
Once `./configure` succeeds, the bazel failure should go away.

Exporting those environment variables is a good idea.

And thanks for reminding `%VS140COMNTOOLS%` environment variable, that could be very helpful.
